Input / Output¶

Introduction¶

Hello World

Created on Thu Oct 6 12:53:52 2011

@author: Stuart Mumford

FortranFile stolen from: Neil Martinsen-Burrell [via Enthought Mailing list]

class pysac.io.FortranFile(fname, mode='r', buf=0)[source]¶

File with methods for dealing with fortran unformatted data files

readInts()[source]¶

Read in an array of integers with error checking

readReals(prec='d')[source]¶

Read in an array of reals (given precision) with error checking

readRecord()[source]¶

Read a single fortran record

readString()[source]¶

Read in a string with error checking

setEndian(c)[source]¶

Set endian to big (c=’>’) or little (c=’<’) or native (c=’@’)

Parameters :c : string

The endian-ness to use when reading from this file.

writeReals(reals, prec='d')[source]¶

Write an array of floats in given precision

Parameters :
reals : array

Data to write

prec : string

Character code for the precision to use in writing
writeString(s)[source]¶

Write a string

Parameters :
  • s: the string to write
class pysac.io.SACdata[source]¶

A class containing conservative varible definitions and sac only data update methods. Designed to be subclassed, so SACfile and SAChdf5 can share common methods without horrible file inheratance

get_thermalp(beta=False)[source]¶

Calculate Thermal pressure from varibles

class pysac.io.SACfile(fname, mode='r', buf=0)[source]¶

Specification of VACFile for the reading of SAC files, to calculate the total from the background and pertuabation parts. Also defines:

w_sac: Dict, containing conservative varibles as sum of
background and pertubation parts.
class pysac.io.SAChdf5(fname, mode='r', buf=0)[source]¶

Specification of VAChdf5 for the reading of SACHDF5 files, to calculate the total from the background and pertuabation parts. Also defines:

w_sac: Dict, containing conservative varibles as sum of
background and pertubation parts.
